description: military force created by the African Union Peace and Security Council in April 2017 and backed by the United Nations Security Council (UNSC Resolution 2359); comprised of forces from Burkina Faso, Chad, Mali, Mauritania, and Niger that are authorized to conduct cross-border military/counter-terrorism operations in a 100-km strip on either side of the countries’ shared borders; the Joint Force at full strength is comprised of 5,000 troops in seven battalions spread across three zones: West, Center, and East
